subject: Communication
title: IQ vs. EQ: The Great Debate
description: A quick, practical guide to IQ vs. EQ: The Great Debate.

hook.text: The student with the highest IQ in her class became a mid-level analyst. The class clown became the CEO.

buildup.text: Research shows IQ accounts for about 20% of life success. The other 80% includes emotional and social intelligence.

discovery.text: IQ gets you in the door. EQ determines how far you go â€” especially in roles requiring leadership, teamwork, and.

twist.text: IQ is largely fixed by late adolescence. EQ is learnable at any age. Your emotional brain never stops being trainable.

climax.text: The most effective people combine both: enough IQ to be competent, enough EQ to be influential.

punchline.text: IQ opens doors. EQ builds the rooms behind them.

quiz.question: What percentage of life success does IQ typically account for?
